lines.text: I hate that Nellie Oleson!
Laura! Don't say "hate" - don't even think "hate"! I'm sure Nellie has her good qualities somewhere.
Your ma's right, half-pint. Now on the way home, we'll try and think of some!
Half the time, you don't even SMELL like a girl! You're either sweaty, or you stink of fish!
Well... I sweat a lot and I fish a lot!

[to her husband, who holds a shotgun, when they catch daughter Nellie with her new husband]
Nels - make her a WIDOW!
If God wanted me to talk with my hands, he wouldn't have given me a mouth.

[looks toward the camera very seriously]
I guess even God can make mistakes!

[after an argument]
Mrs. Ingalls, we will not be requiring any more eggs in the immediate future.
Mrs. Oleson, the hens will be RELIEVED to hear that!
Nels, are you going to miss me?

[mutters]
Like a crutch.
What did you say?
I said, "very much."
I wanted to clean the blackboards extra good today, to make up for being late.
And talking in class?
I was NOT talking!
You were, too!
Was NOT! Nellie was TALKING and I was ANSWERING.
You know something, Mary...?
No, what?
Life sure is a lot easier when you don't like boys!
My back is killing me again...
[in the presence of Mrs. Ingalls]

[doing inventory on his shoes]
... and again, and again...
What did you say?
I'm just counting these shoe sizes dear. And a ten and a ten, four sizes.
You disgraced me in front of the town.

[trying to heal their broken marriage]
Please - there must be forgiveness!
Don't talk to me about forgiveness 'til you lived with a woman like that!
tssskkk
[both of them leave the church]
[repeated line]
Oh, for HEAVEN'S sakes!
Why don't you give like the rest of the children?
My mother say's we're not like the rest of the children!
I suppose she's right.
Ma, please don't tell me I'm too young to know how I feel!
I wasn't going to tell you that, and don't ever raise your voice to me while you live in this house.

[to Mrs. Oleson]
You should be locked up in a cage and fed with a stick; you have made life miserable for everyone.
I'll be working for Nellie. It's not the same.
Besides a few pounds, there's no difference.
Sometimes I wonder how Harriet Oleson has managed to stay alive for as long as she has!
[repeated line]
YOU HATE ME!
I'll fix her. You'll see.
[repeated line]
PA!
